page.title: 05 FUNTINGTON FORGE
page.content: The forge is owned by Mr.Wilkinson. He has been a blacksmith for 30 years. On average he shoes about five horses a day at a price of Â£15 per set.To shoe a horse it will take between one and a half and two hours.The shoes come in 12 sizes.The largest one he has made was 22 inches across.He also does surgical work.He is kept busy as there are 6 riding schools in the district.The shoes are made of steel except for racing horses' shoes which are made of aluminium.Some of the tools are the anvil,that weighs 125kg.,pick mallet and hammer.Instead of the old bellows they now use electric ones.
